page.title: 07Bradbourne Lakes
page.content: Bradbourne Lakes consists of five lakes, some bigger than others. On each lake there are many kinds of birds for example Mallards,Greylag Geese,Mute Swans,Moorhens and others. People go to the lakes for pleasure and enjoyment. Lots of small children go fishing with nets for tiny fish or they feed the ducks and geese. Many children also sail model boats. The lakes are man-made and were originally made for the Bradbourne Estate. The streams run into the head of the River Darenth. The Bradbourne Lakes are split in two by Betenson Avenue Which runs through the middle of them. There are many trees in the grounds including Oak,Chestnut,Horse Chestnut,Willow and several others. There are a few small man-made islands to help birds breed.
